      • handle

        public void handle(java.lang.String resource,
                   org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request jettyReq,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   javax.servlet.ServletException
        The main callback from Jetty.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler
        Specified by:
        handle in class org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
        Parameters:
        resource - what is the user asking for from the server?
        jettyReq - the same object as the next argument, req, just cast to a jetty-specific class (we don't need it).
        req - http request object -- has information from the user.
        resp - http response object -- where we respond to the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - -- If the user hangs up on us while we're writing back or gave us a half-request.
        javax.servlet.ServletException - -- If we ask for something that's not there, this might happen.
